author: Bańka-Kowalczyk, Magdalena
fulltext: oai:clarin-pl.eu:11321/50;2015-01-29T15:14:58Z;hdl_11321_3;hdl_11321_4;International Women's Day Corpus;Bańka-Kowalczyk, Magdalena;International Women's Day;woman;champion of work;work competition;league of women;work;The corpus contains articles form the daily "Trybuna Ludu" from years 1949-1956.The articles dealt with the situation of women, they were especially concerned with the International Women's Day (arrangements and celebration). "Trybuna Ludu" was first published in 1948 and was the main tool of the communist propaganda. Articles in Trybuna Ludu regard the life of the government, report visits by representatives of friendly countries and point to the threat to peace on the part of the imperialist countries. Moreover, journalists explained the communist doctrine and described the lives of the workers, as well as organizations – including women name: 078ac7d8-0896-5814-81a3-8310b8f1b20f
notes: The corpus contains articles form the daily "Trybuna Ludu" from years 1949-1956.The articles dealt with the situation of women, they were especially concerned with the International Women's Day (arrangements and celebration). "Trybuna Ludu" was first published in 1948 and was the main tool of the communist propaganda. Articles in Trybuna Ludu regard the life of the government, report visits by representatives of friendly countries and point to the threat to peace on the part of the imperialist countries. Moreover, journalists explained the communist doctrine and described the lives of the workers, as well as organizations – including women organizations.
title: International Women's Day Corpus
